themes: inclusivity of artist-owned spaces in funding
need for entrepreneurial and business training for artists
access to public art opportunities for studio artists
mentorship and skill-building pathways in public art
key_phrases: applicants given more space to share details
expanded to include self-funded, artist-owned spaces like my own, And&And Studios
more entrepreneurial support—such as training in creative spaces business models, fundraising, and space sustainability
more hands-on pathways into public art, including mentorships, apprenticeships, volunteer opportunities, and training on outdoor materials and fabrication
studio artists are eager to engage in public work but need support to build the necessary skills—from proposal writing to working with fabricators
barriers_identified: difficult to communicate ambitious or interdisciplinary ideas
exclusion of self-funded, artist-owned spaces from funding
lack of entrepreneurial support for artists running their own spaces
insufficient hands-on pathways and training for studio artists to enter public art
solutions_proposed: give applicants more space to share details about proposed projects
expand Creative Space Assistance Program to include self-funded, artist-owned spaces
provide entrepreneurial support such as training in business models, fundraising, and space sustainability
create more hands-on pathways into public art including mentorships, apprenticeships, volunteer opportunities, and training on outdoor materials and fabrication
offer support for skill-building in proposal writing and working with fabricators for studio artists
